channel.title: Server Advertisements
channel.description:
I have came to the conclusion that I prefer to play servers rather than administrator and run them. That being said, it is becoming extremely difficult to find a half decent server to call home. I enjoy RSPS a lot but most of the current servers available are very off-putting.
Below are some of my opinions on the aspects servers have to offer.
[b]Slogans[/b] Just stop them. Your server is not the #1 server ever. It doesn't have flawless features and it doesn't have 100% skilling. Your server is also not the place legends come to. They are annoying and tacky. Just find a nice name and use a small description (i.e. old school economy server, not #1 PI leech).
[b]Staff Positions[/b] I immediately click off your server advertisement if you say "looking for staff join now!". This is obviously a ploy to attract more attention to your server, and it will only attract the scum of internet society. This is detrimental to your server. In my opinion, all server owners should pick staff based on a couple of attributes:
[ul][li]The player has actually played and experienced most aspects of your game[/li] [li]You know them a little. Why would you give some one powers to your game if you don't know their intentions?[/li][/ul]
[b]Development[/b] Please actually development your server a bit before putting it online. It is not hard to spot a leech at all. Your server will be riddled with all the bugs that was released with that download and I won't even consider playing it because of this fact.
[b]Revision[/b] Cool, a 317. Just what I am looking for. Oh, 525 animations and 718 items? Technically your log in protocol is still a 317 BUT THIS JUST MISLEADS ME! I am fed up of clicking on a thread expecting to be able to play an old school server for it to have a 637 cache mixed with 718 items and sprites.
I prefer to play an old school looking server (<= 474), with old school looking animations (<= 474). I do not give a monkey's uncle if you want to load mixed revisions... just don't advertise it as a 317. Then I won't click it.

item.title: Server Advertisements
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I didn’t read through every post but I seen a few where the suggestion of toughening up the rules on the server advertisements board came up, honestly I disagree. People who put in the effort get players, people who don’t put in the effort don’t get players. You get what you give in my opinion.

Apologies if this has been posted in the past few posts.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisements
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

The fact of the matter is that there is no rule concerning false advertisement unless it is leading a person to a site they don’t intend to visit. Telling someone your server is a 718 when in actuality its a 474 is still leading a person to a private server website, which isn’t false advertisement as far as myself or the majority of the rest of the staff is concerned.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisements
item.dc:creator: @Clue_Scroll Clue Scroll
item.description:
@Clue_Scroll wrote:

If we all held back on what everyone else was thinking then there’d be no topics to post on. Just making my presence known from what my views are on the community we are a part of.

[quote=“Flame_, post:8, topic:537975”]I’ll leave my input from my experience of having moderated the server advertisements board for quite a while now.

great read. i agree with everything you’re saying. honestly server advertisements should have to be approved before being posted

That would do nothing except give myself and other moderators unnecessary work. Unless an advertisement is directly breaking any rules I generally don’t touch the advertisement.

Might be a good suggestion to put forward. It is currently very relaxed, some standard would improve the quality no end.

Although, the way RL handle their advertisement section is a bit strict. I don’t think we should take a leaf out of their book.

A relaxed environment is better than a strict one. Although the board being very relaxed isn’t exactly the case behind the scenes.

Your suggestion isn’t the first time its been received. The argument that has stood since the first time around is simply, the more effort put into an advertisement and server is proportionate to the amount of attention it will get.[/quote]
Sure thing. It was a topic for discussion, and a rant on my part in hope that just a view of the culprits would view this and think differently.

Regarding the moderation part of the comment, I do think some standards in place would far out weigh the effort to moderate them. That is what sectional moderators are for. People should have the freedom to post what they want, but at the same time, false advertisement and minimal effort should be pruned, and more in-depth information would greatly be appreciated by the members who are using the forums, looking for a server. Organisation goes a long way.

Read full topic
